info.title: iReceptor Data Source API
info.description: Documentation of Major Version 2 of the iReceptor Adaptive Immune Receptor Repertoire (AIRR) data repsoitory web service application programming interface (API). V2 of the API implements an increased level of compliance with the [Minimal Information for AIRR (MiAIRR) standard](https://github.com/airr-community/airr-standards). Learn more about [iReceptor](http://www.ireceptor.org/)

ir_subject_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a subject.

ir_project_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a project.

ir_project_parent_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a parent/child relationship between this project and its parent project.

ir_lab_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a lab.

ir_case_control_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an element in the case_control table.

ir_sample_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a sample.

ir_dna_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a DNA type.

ir_project_sample_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an association a project with a sample.

ir_sample_subject_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an association between a sample and a subject.

ir_sample_source_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an association between a sample and a sample source.

germline_database.description: Source of germline V(D)J segments, with version number or date accessed (e.g. IMGT/V-QUEST Release 201736-4 (7 September 2017)) (AIRR)

cell_index.description: Cell Index (UID linking sequences from the same cell) (AIRR)

junction_nt.description: JUNCTION nucleotide sequence (Sequence of the CDR3 region (nucleotide)) (AIRR)

junction_aa.description: JUNCTION amino acid sequence (Sequence of the CDR3 region (amino acid)) (AIRR)

duplicate_count.description: Number of times the sequence has been duplicated in a file (AIRR)

an_extended_model_element.description: This does not seem to extend the model, it replaces it!

vdjregion_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped vdj region amino acid sequence

vjregion_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped vj region amino acid sequence

djregion_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped dj region amino acid sequence

vregion_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped v region amino acid sequence

dregion_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped d region amino acid sequence

jregion_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped j region amino acid sequence

fr1region_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped fr1 region amino acid sequence

fr2region_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped fr2 region amino acid sequence

fr3region_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped fr3 region amino acid sequence

fr4region_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped fr4 region amino acid sequence

cdr1region_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped cdr1 region amino acid sequence

cdr2region_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped cdr2 region amino acid sequence

cdr3region_sequence_aa_gapped.description: gapped cdr3 region amino acid sequence

sequence_count.description: The number of sequences that match the filter for this sample.

study_id.description: Alphanumeric UID assigned by NCBI (e.g. PRJNA349) (AIRR)

study_title.description: Publication or Protocol Title (e.g. My Study) (AIRR)

pubs_ids.description: Alphanumeric UID assigned by NCBI (e.g. PRJNA349) (AIRR)

age.description: Age - Time duration and unit (e.g. 200 days) (AIRR)

linked_subjects.description: Relation to other subjects (SubjectID e.g. SUB1355648) (AIRR)

sample_id.description: Biological sample ID - UID assigned by submitter (AIRR)

disease_state_sample.description: Disease state of sample (e.g. tumor vs margin) (AIRR)

collection_time_event.description: Collection time event (T0) (e.g. vaccination, recruitment, etc) (AIRR)

source_commercial.description: Commercial source of sample (e.g. XYZ Pharma) (AIRR)

study_group_description.description: Study group description (e.g. Case vs. Control) (AIRR)

subject_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a subject.

project_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a project.

project_parent_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a parent/child relationship between this project and its parent project.

lab_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a lab.

case_control_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an element in the case_control table.

sample_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a sample.

dna_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify a DNA type.

project_sample_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an association a project with a sample.

sample_subject_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an association between a sample and a subject.

sample_source_db_id.description: Identifier used internally by the repository to identify an association between a sample and a sample source.

get.description:
This service returns metadata about samples, including higher-level meta-data around the study, subject, diagnosis, and sample processing (data relevant to MiAIRR data classes 1 through 3). The data returned is filtered based on the parameters provided.
A successful call returns a json list with a sample level summary of each sample including a summary count of the number of sequences found for that sample.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the individual requesting access to the iReceptor repository node.

200.description:
A successful call returns an array of sample summary metadata for
each sample that meets the search criteria. The metadata returned
for each sample includes the number of sequences found for that sample
as well as the study/subject/sample data for that sample. The metadata
for each sample in the response contains a set of AIRR compliant data
as well as repository specific data that is required to query the
repository about those types of elements.

post.description:
This service returns metadata about samples, including higher-level meta-data around the study, subject, diagnosis, and sample processing (data relevant to MiAIRR data classes 1 through 3). The data returned is filtered based on the parameters provided.
A successful call returns a json list with a sample level summary of each sample including a summary count of the number of sequences found for that sample.

username.description: Username of the individual requesting access to the iReceptor repository node.

200.description: A successful call returns the metadata for each sample, including the number of sequences found for that sample.

get.description: This service returns a summary of sequences that matches the GET provided filter. "username" parameter refers to external_users table.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the individual requesting access to the iReceptor repository node.

parameters.name: cdr3_length
parameters.description: length of complementarity determining region in nucleotide base pairs

200.description: A successful call returns two components, an aggregated summary of the data that satisfies the query and an example subset of the annotated sequence data that meets the query criteria. The aggreated data returns a summary similar to that returned by the /samples API entry point, returning the number of sequences and the study/subject/sample meta-data for each sample. The example subset of sequence data that is returned is a small subset of annotated sequences that met the search criteria. The number of sequences returned is given in the "num_sequences" paramter to the query and the format in which the sequences are returned is provided by the "sequence_format" parameter to the query.

get.description: This service returns the annotation data that matches the GET provided filter. "username" parameter refers to external_users table, and it requires the array of "project_sample_id", which limits which samples the sequences will be taken from. Other parameters are optional, and refer to the sequence_md_view view in iReceptor database.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the individual requesting access to the iReceptor repository node.

parameters.name: cdr3_length
parameters.description: length of complementarity determining region in nucleotide base pairs

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: 'csv' - vQuest based CSV (as per /v1);  'tsv' - vQuest based TSV (as per /v1 with tab delimiters instead of commas); 'airr' - AIRR Formats rearrangements TSV (as per AIRR formats rearrangements spec)

200.description: A successful call returns an array of sequence data. Optional "format" parameter determines the output format. Default is a JSON response, limited to top 50 results. If "format" is set to "csv", it will return all the matching sequence annotations, in addition to sample information and annotation tool information, in a comma-separated format; "tsv" returns a tab-delimited outputs;  "airr" returns AIRR minimal standards encoded tab-delimited outputs.

post.description: This service returns the annotation data that matches the POST provided filter. "username" parameter refers to external_users table, and it requires the array of "project_sample_id", which limits which samples the sequences will be taken from. Other parameters are optional, and refer to the sequence_md_view view in iReceptor database. A full list of possible parameters is in the iReceptorAPI-sequenceMetadata file

username.description: Username of the individual requesting access to the iReceptor repository node.

cdr3_length.description: length of complementarity determining region in nucleotide base pairs

format.description: 'csv' - vQuest based CSV (as per /v1);  'tsv' - vQuest based TSV (as per /v1 with tab delimiters instead of commas); 'airr' - AIRR Formats rearrangements TSV (as per AIRR formats rearrangements spec)

200.description: A successful call returns an array of sequence data. Optional "format" parameter determines the output format. Default is a JSON response, limited to top 50 results. If "format" is set to "csv", it will return all the matching sequence annotations, in addition to sample information and annotation tool information, in a comma-separated format; "tsv" returns a tab-delimited outputs;  "airr" returns AIRR minimal standards encoded tab-delimited outputs.

get.description: This service returns a summary of sequence clones that match the GET provided filter. "username" parameter refers to external_users table.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the individual requesting access to the iReceptor repository node.

parameters.name: cdr3_length
parameters.description: length of complementarity determining region in nucleotide base pairs

200.description: A successful call returns an summary of clone data as an array of 'category' = count pairs in which the 'category' are string tags of parameters of interest from a controlled vocabulary term set.

get.description: This service returns a list of clones that matches the GET provided filter. "username" parameter refers to external_users table.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the individual requesting access to the iReceptor repository node.

parameters.name: cdr3_length
parameters.description: length of complementarity determining region in nucleotide base pairs

200.description: A successful call returns an array of sequence data. Optional "output" parameter determines the output format. Default is a JSON response, limited to top 50 results. If "output" is set to "csv", it will return all the matching sequence annotations, in addition to sample information and annotation tool information, in a comma-separated format.

citation.title: RNA-Seq Analysis of Gene Expression, Viral Pathogen, and B-Cell/T-Cell Receptor Signatures in Complex Chronic Disease.
